org.openlcb.implementations
Class BlueGoldEngine

java.lang.Object
  org.openlcb.AbstractConnection
      org.openlcb.MessageDecoder
          org.openlcb.implementations.BlueGoldEngine
All Implemented Interfaces:
Connection
Direct Known Subclasses:
BlueGoldExtendedEngine
public class BlueGoldEngine
extends MessageDecoder
implements Connection

Example of a OpenLCB algorithm for doing configuration with small number of buttons.

  • On learners, push blue to choose a C/P and put that C/P in learn mode (complete cycle turns off blue light and starts over)
  • On the teaching node, push blue to choose a C/P, push Gold to send the TeachEvent message

This handles both "configuring" and "being configured" cases. It also handles both consumers and producers via working with the SingleConsumerNode and SingleProducerNode example classes.

For button inputs, it currently has only "click" operations. Perhaps "down" and "up" will be needed eventually. Similarly, it only does "on" and "off" for the two lights.

Author:
Bob Jacobsen Copyright 2009
